These can be sent by email, exported, and viewed right there. The problem is that, in IIS, I am getting WAS errors that cause my application to crash. This results in all connected users being logged out. It is an application built in ASP.NET (vb) 64 bits. Currently, to analyze the WAS, I am generating dump files that I then analyze with WinDGB. entry.title: Re: What is should be the set up process for multi curren...
entry.content:
1.  you need to use the field bank type (LFBK-BVTYP) for CLABE vs. the 11 digit account number (so you create 2 bank account entries and enter the partner bank type as USD vs. MXN.  You can use an FI substitution to pick the correct partner bank type when processing a vendor invoice.  The field during invoice processing is called the same - partner bank type.

2.  The above setup will now steer the individual transactions according to currency to either bank account via F110.

3. Essentially the answer is already provided - the system will issue 2 payments - one for MXN and one for USD.  Obviously you may need different payment methods to process the different currencies but that's beyond the scope of your question.

entry.title: Reducing Weeks to Minutes: AI, ABAP, and Low-Code in SAP Development
entry.content:
Introduction

The creation of SAP applications has always required a combination of technical and functional knowledge. In many scenarios, ABAP developers need to master SAPUI5 to deliver modern, SAP Fiori-style applications that meet end-user expectations.

However, the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools with low-code platforms opens a new path: enabling ABAP developers to build complete applications without needing SAPUI5 knowledge, while still allowing continuous maintenance in a simple and secure way.

Tachyonix has developed an innovative approach that transforms business specifications into technical specifications through specialized AI tools, significantly accelerating the development process and drastically reducing delivery time.

Architecture

  • Flow with LLM

  • Flow with Tachyonix Builder

How ABAP Integration with AI Works

The flow begins with a specification provided by the user. For example: ‚ÄúI need a report that shows pending sales orders.‚Äù

From this request, different AI tools are triggered (these are some examples):

  • ABAP Package Tool: identifies the correct technical package where the application will be created.

  • Data Source Tool: selects the best source of data, indicating one or more relevant CDS Views.

  • Field Retrieval Tool: suggests the most appropriate fields to compose the application‚Äôs main list, based on the user‚Äôs description.

  • Floorplan Tool: recommends the visual structure of the application (for example, Master-Detail).

After these agents work together, a consolidated JSON containing the full technical specification is generated. This artifact is then used by the application creation agent:

  • Application Creation Tool: automatically builds the application according to the selected floorplan and the technical specifications provided by the other tools.

This flow allows complete applications to be created without manual programming, while still adhering to SAP best practices and design standards.

Integration with the Tachyonix Low-Code Platform

The main differentiator lies in the integration of this automation with the Tachyonix low-code platform. The generated application is not delivered as rigid, hard-to-maintain source code. On the contrary ‚Äî it remains fully editable and extensible, allowing ABAP developers to continue evolving the solution without dealing directly with SAPUI5 or JavaScript.

This approach differs from what is sometimes called vibe-coding, in which an LLM directly generates source code. In the Tachyonix model, the LLM does not generate code. Instead, it produces structured technical specifications, which are then processed by a creation agent. This design ensures:

  • Security and predictability of the result.

  • Ease of maintenance and customization.

  • No risks associated with unreadable or unsupportable generated code.

Practical Advantages

  • Speed: a process that could take weeks is reduced to minutes.

  • Productivity: developers spend only a few hours making final adjustments and personalizations.

  • Accessibility: even without SAPUI5 expertise, ABAP developers can deliver modern applications.

  • Flexibility: applications evolve continuously within the low-code platform, without technical barriers.

Knowledge Graph as AI Support

At the time of writing this article, SAP Joule does not yet provide a public API for external consumption. For this reason, Tachyonix developed its own Knowledge Graph, which brings together SAP business scenarios.

This repository is used as a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) mechanism, ensuring that the LLM always has access to reliable, contextual information throughout the process.

Conclusion

The combination of ABAP tools with a low-code platform represents a significant step forward for the ABAP community. This approach does not replace the developer ‚Äî it empowers them. With it, value can be delivered faster, more securely, and more sustainably, even without SAPUI5 knowledge.

In a market where time is a competitive advantage, solutions like Tachyonix reduce development cycles from weeks to minutes and establish a new paradigm for SAP application development.

As we are discussing AI, I leveraged HeyGen, an AI-based video creator, to demonstrate the process
Link: https://youtu.be/_VPU-Dps0sA

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 18th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/18/sap-developer-news-september-18th-2025/

UI5con Bengaluru 2025

Introducing eslint-plugin-better-cap-config an ESLint plugin to improve CAP configuration 

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-eslint-plugin-better-cap-config-an-eslint-plugin-to-improve-cap/ba-p/14209616 
  • NPM Package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-plugin-better-cap-config 
  • GitHub Repo: https://github.com/mauriciolauffer/eslint-plugin-better-cap-config 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Avoiding Data Loss When Loading Initial Data with CSV Files in CAP  

0:58 50k Subscribers 

1:58 Devtoberfest 

3:52 UI5con Bengaluru 2025 

4:20 eslint-plugin-better-cap-config 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 18th, 2025.

[DJ] When creating solutions with CAP and following the recommended local first development philosophy, you'll know about the immense utility of initial and sample data loading via CSV files. Some of you also may know about the things to look out for when subsequently deploying data to SAP HANA Cloud. If you don't, well, even if you do, it's definitely worth reading this blog post published recently by SAP champion MioYasutake. It serves as a reminder of the feature and the challenge and also walks through some alternative approaches. Link in the description.

[Mamikee] We're so close to reaching a huge milestone here on the SAP Developers YouTube channel. 50K subscribers. Right now, we're sitting at about 49.8K, which means we just need a few hundred more of you to help us cross that line. Now, if you've been watching our tutorials, following the SAP developer news, participating in Devtoberfest , and all of our technical deep dives, now is the perfect time to hit that subscribe button. Subscribing doesn't just get you notified of our latest content, it makes you part of this growing global developer community. A community that's learning together, building together, and shaping the future of SAP development. here is the challenge, let's see if we can reach 50k before Devtoberfest . It's a celebration for developers around the world, and hitting this milestone together will make it even more special. So, don't wait. Click subscribe, turn on the notification, and help us celebrate the Big 50.

[Tom] Hey Devtoberfest is a little over a week away It is hard to believe, seems like just the other day we were starting to planning and preparations for the Devtoberfest , here it is, on top of us. we have all the fun and learning opportunities that you have come to know from previous years of Devtoberfest, plus a few new surprises this year. I had a look at the calendar of content on the community the other day, and it is chock full of educational sessions that I know I can't wait to attend myself. And it's going to have everything you need to help you get ready for TechEd this year. You know, TechEd, we're going to hear about lots of new AI innovations, changes in development capabilities, new functionality across the board in SAP BTP. and if you need to get up to speed on what some of these things are and how to get ready to learn about all the new innovations, Devtoberfest is the place to be. And don't forget, we'll be running the contest again this year. If you'd like an opportunity to perhaps win an all -expense-paid trip to next year's SAP TechEd in-person experience, then be sure to take part in the Devtoberfest contest. We'll have 10 winners from last year joining us in Berlin and we can't wait to see who the new winners are going to be joining us wherever TechEd is in the following year. So be on the lookout for everything DevToverFest. Check out the community calendar so you don't miss any of the sessions and join the DevToverFest community group so that you're registered for the contest. And don't forget to do all those validation tutorials and scavenger hunt and everything else where you can earn points for DevToverFest. So we look forward to bringing you another great DevToverfest this year. We'll see you all around the community and on those sessions on the SAP Developers YouTube channel. Hi everyone, and welcome to the SAP Developer News. Just a quick announcement.

[Nico] After a six-year-long break, UI5Con is back in Bangalore, India. End of November, early December, there's no exact date yet. UI5Con will be back in India, so watch this space for more information. Very exciting. Hope to see you soon. Bye.

[Tom] Hi, I want to tell you about a nifty new little plugin supplied by one of our community members and fellow SAP employees. Mauricio has recently written a blog post about his available open source ESLint plugin. for the cloud application programming model. Now, this is part of, or taking advantage of an expanded effort for ESLint to focus on more languages and capabilities than just JavaScript and TypeScript. And he's using the JSON plugin that was already available and building on top of it to allow you to parse and check the configuration files specific to CAP, like the package a song but the additional functionality that he has added is checking for deprecated features and keys so if you think that would be a useful addition to your CAP development environment check out his blog post today and install and start using that plug-in.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Error during package import
entry.content:
Hello experts,

for our SAP Datasphere system we use export/import packages as a tool to transport changes from DEV system to PROD. We've already deployed some objects in PROD system. Now we need to transport some changes from DEV to PROD.And during package's import we have faced the error like "VIEW_NAME#USNAM can't be deleted because it's currently used by VIEW_NAME_2".  Both views are in this import package, "Dependency Included" mark is set, and both views are from the same space and . Package's option "Overwrite Preferences" was "Overwrite objects and data", and checkbox "Deploy after import" was selected. 

So, I have 2 questions:

  1. Is #USNAM part is somehow meaningful? Because technical name of view doesn't contain that. Or it's just some internal system, stuff?
  2. I don't understand what to do in this case because import package has both objects, so why system didn't overwrite it? Did I miss something?
    Also in the same package we faced same issue, but that was a pair of a local table and replication flow, and to resolve that issue we have deleted RF from PROD system (anyway we had it in the same package), but it isn't looking as a correct way

entry.title: Rehire with Old Employment Failing Replication
entry.content:
Hello!

My team is trying to understand a replication issue we've encountered, caused by Rehire with Old Employment records.

The scenario we‚Äôve encountered is:

  • When we perform a Rehire on Old Employment, as soon as the verification step is complete, a job information Rehire entry appears on the employee profile in EC.
  • This happens *before* Manage Pending Hires is completed.
  • This entry replicates and throws an error

See example employee Zach Booth. This Rehire record appeared on his old employment record (the name one where his termination record is) before onboarding was completed.

Zach Booth in Onboarding:

Based on my research, this is expected behavior (source: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3195854).

It is difficult to manage these replication errors, and it feels unintuitive to have these records created before Manage Pending Hires is completed.

Can you confirm that my understanding is correct? Can you help me understand why this happens and how other clients manage it?

entry.title: MDK Listpicker problem
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm working with a ListPicker in SAP MDK and I‚Äôve run into a strange issue with the setValue method.

In my project, I have a function that is executed in different places. In most cases, setValue works fine and the ListPicker is updated with the expected value.

The issue is that in one specific scenario, although the same code is executed (with the same calls and same values), the setValue call does not update the control on the screen. There are no errors in the console or log ‚Äì the value just doesn‚Äôt change.

This is my code:

if (variedadId) {
                const cuadros = await clientAPI.read(service, 'Cuadro', [], `$filter=ID_QUINTA eq ${quintaId}`);
                const variedadIds = [...new Set(toArray(cuadros).map(c => c.ID_VARIEDAD))];
                
                const variedadSpecifier = variedadPicker.getTargetSpecifier();
                variedadSpecifier.setQueryOptions(`$filter=${variedadIds.map(id => `ID_VARIEDAD eq ${id}`).join(' or ')}`);
                await variedadPicker.setTargetSpecifier(variedadSpecifier);

                await variedadPicker.setValue(variedadId);

                ShowToast(clientAPI,`Variedad seteada: VariedadID: ${variedadId}-Variedad:${record.VARIEDAD}`)
            }

At the end of the function, I show a toaster message with the selected ID and variety. Both values are displayed correctly, which means the data is fine. However, the ListPicker itself does not reflect the expected selection ‚Äì instead, it automatically defaults to the first option.

The ID I normally work with is 19. When I try with other IDs (for example 0 or 1), it seems like the ListPicker tries to interpret it as an index instead of setting the actual value.

entry.title: Service Interfaces and ABAP Proxy generation support in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog describes how to import Service Interface objects from SAP PI /PO ESR to Cloud Integration Capability of SAP Integration Suite and also the procedure to connect SAP R3 or S/4 HANA systems to Integration Suite tenant and generate ABAP-Proxies.

This feature is available in SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration (6.69.41 ) standard and above service plans.

Pre-requisites :

1. Configuring Cloud Connector

The first step is to configure SAP Cloud Connector with on premise ES Repository. Cloud connector is an installable application that allows you to establish communication between on premise and cloud applications. To know more about SAP Cloud Connector, see https://help.sap.com/viewer/cca91383641e40ffbe03bdc78f00f681/Cloud/en-US/e6c7616abb5710148cfcf3e75d9...

2. Configure Connection to ESR

Please refer to the following documentation for details on configuration of ESR system details in Cloud Integration Settings page.

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/configuring-connectivity-to-es-rep...

Once the ES Repository configurations are completed, you can import the Service Interface objects  from your ES Repository.

Importing Service Interface Artifact :

1. Create a new Integration Package or Open an existing Integration Package.

2. Click on Edit and switch to the Artifacts tab

3. Expand Add menu  and select Service Interface option from the list.

4. A Wizard with title Add Service Interface  and steps to be followed is displayed. 

5. Select the SAP Process Integration system in the Name dropdown and click on connect. On successful Connection, the Service Interface artifacts present in the ES Repository of the connected SAP PI/PO system are listed.

6. Select a Service Interface and proceed with Next Step. This step displays the details (Name, Namespace) of the Service Interface that is selected for import along with the dependent Resources used in the definition of Service Interface.

 

7. On Proceeding to Next step, the Summary of the import along with the dependant resources is displayed. 

8. On Click of Add, the selected Service Interface artifact gets created and listed in the Artifacts page.

Editor for Service Interface 

9.   On click of the Service Interface artifact from the Artifacts list page, the artifact gets opened and displayed as follows:

Overview tab :

References tab : 

1)Local  : Lists the External Messages/RFCs/IDOCs used in the definition of the Operation(s) of the Service Interface artifact as shown as WSDLs

2)Global : Lists the MessageTypes/Fault Message types used in the definition of the Operation(s) of the Service Interface artifact 

Definition Tab :

WSDL :

Next Steps:

In the upcoming releases, the Edit of existing Service Interface and also Creation of Service Interface artifact in Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite would be available.

entry.title: Re: Advanced Bank Account Management (J77) - Create Bank...
entry.content:
Hello @Wayne10 

Thank you for the screenshot; that clarifies the situation very well. What you are seeing is expected in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Within the Starter system, SAP enables a wider range of fields, including the entire Bank Relationship section, which includes Contact Persons for demo and exploration purposes.

On the Customising and Production systems, these fields aren't released for live use. That is the reason why you would not see the section in your tenant, even though CBC shows related settings.

This is not a CBC switch you can enable; the section is simply not part of the delivered bank account masters in the public Cloud.

The Recommendations Provided by SAP

Keep responsible contacts at Business Partner level for the bank master data, or use the Custom Fields and Logic app if you need additional account-level fields in Manage Bank Accounts.

As the test script you mentioned is generic, it still includes steps relevant to on-premise or private cloud environments, which is why the Maintain Internal Bank Account Contact step shows up, even though it is not applicable in a public cloud setting.

Useful SAP Official References

  • SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Advanced Bank Account Management (J77)
  • SAP KBA 2798180 ‚Äì Bank Account Management: Contact Person not available in Public Cloud

The Starter system displays this for demonstration purposes, but in live systems, the Bank Relationship section is not provided. Please use BP or custom fields if you need to record this information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Support for 16KB page compatibility in AppGyver, which Google is requiring
entry.content:
The Google Play Console has now required all Android apps to support 16KB pages by November 1, 2025, and has stated that apps will need to be recompiled to ensure continuous updates. Failure to meet this requirement may result in the app being suspended from the platform.

Since we use AppGyver (no-code) to develop our apps, we don't have direct access to the build settings. Therefore, it is essential that, at the time of creation, the app is generated in compliance with this technical requirement, that is, with support for 16KB pages.

In light of this, I am requesting guidance and support from SAP to ensure that, when editing or creating new apps in AppGyver, the generated build package complies with the new Google Play Console requirements.

Thank you in advance for your attention and I look forward to hearing from you with instructions on how to proceed in this case. If possible, please send me the links where I can ask for help, since the build generated in AppGyver is done using no-code, without the possibility of manual adjustments, and must already be compiled in the version requested by Google.

Project ID: P2006971219
Contact email: portfoliozx@gmail.com

Sincerely,
Vianeis Rodrigues Pereira.

entry.title: Enhancements to SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform Roadmap
entry.content:
We‚Äôre excited to share two important updates that enhance the experience for users working with the SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform Roadmap. These features are designed to make your implementation journey even more seamless and accessible.

Machine Translated SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform Roadmap

Using SAP‚Äôs AI-powered Translation Hub, the SAP Activate for SAP BTP Roadmap can now be viewed in multiple languages directly in the SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer within SAP for Me. This update makes it easier to understand implementation guidance and best practices in the language you‚Äôre most comfortable with.

How to enable machine translation:

  1. Log in to SAP for Me or directly into the SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer portal.
  2. Navigate to My Settings.
  3. Choose your preferred language from the supported list:
    • English
    • German
    • Chinese
    • Korean
    • Japanese
    • French
    • Spanish
    • Portuguese
    • Italian

Once selected, all supported road maps will appear in your chosen language automatically.

 If you notice any translation issues, we encourage you to submit feedback by clicking the Feedback button in the Roadmap Viewer and selecting "Translation errors" as the category.

Your input helps us improve the translation quality for everyone.

Downloadable Project Plan for SAP Activate for SAP BTP Roadmap in Spreadsheet Format

You can now download the project plan for the SAP Activate for SAP BTP roadmap directly from the SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer in a convenient spreadsheet (Excel) format.

This feature allows you to:

  • Review project deliverables
  • Customize your plan as needed
  • Share structured planning content with team members who prefer working in Excel

How to download the project plan:

  1. Open the SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer.
  2. Navigate to the SAP Activate for SAP Business Technology Platform roadmap.
  3. Click on ‚ÄúDownload Project Plan‚Äù.
  4. You should be able to download and save a spreadsheet format of the Project Plan afterwards.

 For real-time project execution and tracking, we continue to recommend using SAP Cloud ALM, which offers the latest roadmap content and integrated project management features.

Share Your Feedback

We continue to gather feedback from our own customer community, our SAP experts, and partners, and we follow an agile methodology to build on the previous version and continuously improve the content.

In the past, your feedback has driven meaningful improvements. Whether it was simplifying navigation, creating new tasks, or updating accelerators, your input has helped us focus on what truly matters to you, during your implementation journey.  You can help us improve by providing feedback in the following ways 

  1. You can provide feedback directly in road map viewer while viewing the content. Refer to the blog Providing Feedback in SAP Activate road map viewer.
  2. Send us a direct email via: sapactivate@sap.com
  3. Leave us your comments in the section below.

Thank you for your continued engagement with SAP Activate!

entry.title: Re: IGS very broken!
entry.content:
I know maybe is very late to post the solution, but just to documented my case, I had a similar situation in an S/4HANA FPS3 after a system conversion and the issue was caused for a miss configuration in the instance profile; I had to add the following entries:

_IG = ig.sap$(SAPSYSTEMNAME)_$(INSTANCE_NAME)
Execute_xx = local rm -f $(_IG)
Execute_xx = local ln -s -f $(DIR_EXECUTABLE)/igswd_mt $(_IG)
Start_Program_xx = local $(_IG) -mode=profile pf=$(_PF)

and delete the following (because they already existed in the DEFAULT profile):

_ENQ enq.sapSID_DXX
_MS ms.sapSID_DXX
enq/serverhost XXXXXXXXXX
enq/serverinst XX
enq/serverport XXXXX
Execute_09 local rm -f $(_MS)
Execute_10 local ln -s -f $(DIR_EXECUTABLE)$(DIR_SEP)msg_server$(FT_EXE) $(_MS)
Execute_11 local rm -f $(_ENQ)
Execute_12 local ln -s -f $(DIR_EXECUTABLE)$(DIR_SEP)enq_server$(FT_EXE) $(_ENQ)
Start_Program_00 local $(_MS) pf=$(DIR_PROFILE)$(DIR_SEP)SID_DXX_xxxxxxxxxx
Start_Program_01 local $(_ENQ) pf=$(DIR_PROFILE)$(DIR_SEP)SID_DXX_xxxxxxxxxx
Start_Program_02 local $(_DW) pf=$(_PF)

After been do it this adjustment the IGS starts to work again.

Hope this solution works for someone else.

Ruben S√°nchez

entry.title: How to add a custom button to the RichTextEditor Toolbar?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am very new to Fiori Development and need some help.  I am implementing a Fiori App utilizing the Rich Text Editor.  The application is based on a CDS Data Model to generate a List-Detail experience.  On the Detail Page, a custom section was used to provide the user with the Rich Text Editor to provide formatting, such as Bold, Italic, etc. text which would be saved to a string in the table.  This works perfectly for the text editing.  Now, some custom buttons are required for additional functionality.   However, I have been struggling to add custom buttons to the toolbar.

The fragment definition for the custom section is below.

<core:FragmentDefinition
  xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
  xmlns="sap.m"
  xmlns:rte="sap.ui.richtexteditor"
>

  <rte:RichTextEditor
    id="_IDGenRichTextEditor"
    value="{LongText}"
    height="300px"
    width="100%"
    required="false"
    editable="true"

    showGroupClipboard="true" 
    showGroupFont="true"
    showGroupInsert="true"

At first, I thought I could set the property for the custom toolbar and add the button in the fragment definition.  This is similar to some of the sample code I found from the documentation.  However, this has not been working for me.  Below is a sample of what I attempted.  

   customToolbar="true" 
    customButtons="{
      path: '/customButtons',
      template: 'sap.m.Button'
    }"
          <richtexteditor:customButtons>
            <Button
                id="myCustomButton"
                text="My Custom Button"
                press=".onMyCustomButtonPress"
            />
        </richtexteditor:customButtons>

 When this did not work, I thought that it would be best to add a Controller Extension to the Object Page.  I tried to model from a solution I found here. Below is a rough idea of what I attempted in the onInit function.  Unfortunately, this did not work for me either.

 var oRichTextEditor = this.getView().byId("_IDGenRichTextEditor");

            var oButton = new sap.m.Button("button", {
						text: "My Button",
						icon: "sap-icon://eraser",
						press: this.onPress.bind(this)
					});

            oRichTextEditor.addCustomButton(oButton);
			sap.ui.getCore().applyChanges();

Can anyone highlight what am I doing wrong?  Is my approach with the Fragment or the Controller Extension wrong?  I would appreciate it if anyone can shed some light on this for me.  Thanks in advance for your help.

John

entry.title: Re: Failed to "Overwrite with Remote Topic Bindings" - S/...
entry.content:
Hello @TanDT 

Thank you for your detailed explanation and the screenshots.

Have a look at Integrating Enterprise Event Enablement for some details.

To summarise, based on your description, the issue you are seeing indicates a mismatch in field length or data type when the event payload is being written to the event table or transferred.

To solve that issue, I recommend:

  • Ensure to review the payload schema for BOM and change master events, then compare it with the expected data structure in you BTP ABAP inbound topic binding. Direct Push-Based Integration & Recommendations for Customers on using the Direct Push-Based Integration
  • If you don‚Äôt need all the fields in the payload, configure an event filter in the binding to avoid problematic fields. Configuring Inbound Event Topic Bindings
  • Consider not adding all BOM and change master events at the same time. Rather test with only one new event.

Finally, you can raise an incident with SAP if the error persists and ensure you attach the runtime error log and payload definition.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Company Code Specific Customer Data Return - Extration
entry.content:
Dear Team,

Thanks & Regards,
Naveen

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Company Code Specific Customer Data Return - Extration
entry.content:
Dear Naveen,

Customer Data Return was primarily designed to fulfil a legal and contractual obligation from SAP to return customer owned data to customer primarily at the time of offboarding. Hence, the app was only built with the original use case in mind and doesn't provide any kind of backup functionality. We also don't have any other feature in S/4HANA Cloud that provides this kind of data.

 

It is not possible to extract company code/country‚Äìwise data using the Customer Data Return app, as it does not support such filter conditions.

Data extraction is performed at the table level, meaning the entire table data is extracted regardless of any specific column values. Currently, there is no option to apply filters (such as company code) while executing the extraction for a table.

You can try to filter the result of the data extracted to fulfill your requirement.

 

Thanks and Best Regards,

Bell

entry.content:
Hi @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Available Migration Objects & Real estate contract       
To summarise, the Rentable Object without portfolio structure is not currently offered as a standalone migration object in public cloud. However, Usable Object is available and it covers the standard use case for migrating real estate master data.

This means that if you need to migrate RW objects, they must be created or maintained manually in the system after migration of usable objects. If this is a hard requirement for your project, consider submitting a customer influence program to SAP.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Depreciation KEY in Chart of Depr. 3710 (NL) does not...
entry.content:
Hi @Pieter_ 

Thank you for your question.

Have you had a look at Asset Accounting Overview & 3593674 - Changing the depreciation key?

Depreciation keys are country specific and preconfigured as part of the charts of the COD. They are based on local accounting and legal requirements. The COD 3710 description key LINE is configured with base 24 and this drives the calculation using remaining NBV instead of the acquisition value. In contrast, COD 2510 key LINE uses base value.  This is because each country version must align with local regulations.

You can consider using Belgium COD for relevant company code if it is legally permitted.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: [Q]311 Transfer Best Practice: Don‚Äôt Mix MIGO with /SCWM/PRDI or /SCWM/PRDO‚ÄîUse Single-Point Posting
entry.content:
Is this paragraph correct? The gist is that you shouldn‚Äôt first create a delivery in MIGO and then execute it in /SCWM/PRDO, but rather perform the operation at a single point.

For a 311 (same-plant storage-location‚Äìto‚Äìstorage-location one-step transfer), define and follow a single-point posting, single source of truth principle: either post the 311 movement in IM via MIGO/Fiori and stop there, or initiate the move in EWM (warehouse task/posting change) and let the system automatically back-post the IM 311‚Äîdo not perform an additional step in /SCWM/PRDI or /SCWM/PRDO after MIGO. The reason is that 311 does not use deliveries and has no PGI/GR chain, while PRDI/PRDO are EWM apps for delivery-based receiving/shipping. Mixing them (e.g., posting in MIGO and then repeating in PRDI/PRDO) easily leads to double/contradictory postings, queue errors, IM‚ÄìEWM stock mismatches, and broken HU/batch traceability. Only when you adopt a delivery-based process (such as an STO or any scenario that requires PGI/GR across locations/plants) should you process PRDO ‚Üí PGI on the issuing side and PRDI ‚Üí GR on the receiving side‚Äîand in that case you should not use 311.

entry.title: CON2 Revaluation causes many update processes in the queue
entry.content:
During the month-end closing process in our system, when performing the work order revaluation step‚Äîwhether by executing CON2 or running RKAZCON2 via SE38‚Äîother users are unable to retrieve data after creating and saving documents such as Purchase Orders (PO) and Sales Orders (SO).

Upon investigation, we found that while CON2 is running, a large number of update processes in SM13 remain in the "Initial" status. Processes submitted by other users also in the queue.

We currently need to resolve two issues:

  1. The update processes should not interfere with other users' operations.

  2. After the scheduled background job for CON2 is completed, the UPD process of CON2 does not finish promptly. Instead, the update processes continue for an extended period, delaying the monthly closing timeline.

We have conducted the following analysis for reference:
A few minutes after the process starts, the number of queued processes increases significantly. DB12 reveals that a large number of tables are waiting for locks, and updates to the COSS table are consuming substantial time. Implementing Note 543470 did not yield any improvement.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue?

entry.title: SAP B1/SQL Server 2019 Query Error when entering Parameter
entry.content:
If i use QUERY by not use '[%0]' No Problem

SELECT
B.Bo_Pl_No AS [WMS No.],
X.TransferNo AS [Transfer No.],
CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) AS [Date],
P.Tp_ItemCode AS [Item No.],
I.ItemName AS [Item Name],
CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6)) AS [Quantity],
B.Bo_No AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box AS B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick AS P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM AS I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
SELECT
COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ')
WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
FROM OWTR T
JOIN NNM1 S
ON S.Series = T.Series
AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) AS X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo

WHERE
B.Bo_Active = 1
AND P.Tp_Active = 1
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) >= CONVERT(date, ''))
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) <= CONVERT(date, ''))
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR B.Bo_Pl_No = '')
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR B.Bo_No = '')
ORDER BY
B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

But if i entering Parameter such as '[%0]' will be error immediately

Error 'Received Alert' (OAIB)

SELECT
B.Bo_Pl_No AS [WMS No.],
X.TransferNo AS [Transfer No.],
CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) AS [Date],
P.Tp_ItemCode AS [Item No.],
I.ItemName AS [Item Name],
CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6)) AS [Quantity],
B.Bo_No AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box AS B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick AS P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM AS I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
SELECT
COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ')
WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
FROM OWTR T
JOIN NNM1 S
ON S.Series = T.Series
AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) AS X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo

WHERE
B.Bo_Active = 1
AND P.Tp_Active = 1
AND (ISNULL('[%0]','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) >= CONVERT(date, '[%0]'))
AND (ISNULL('[%1]','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) <= CONVERT(date, '[%1]'))
AND (ISNULL('[%2','') = '' OR B.Bo_Pl_No = '[%2]')
AND (ISNULL('[%3]','') = '' OR B.Bo_No = '[%3]')
ORDER BY
B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

entry.title: Re: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in S...
entry.content:
Hello @MohamedKharbouch 

Thank you for the details.

Have a look at Product Cost Planning & Overhead Calculation for details on your question.

However, in public cloud, overhead costs such as sales and administrations costs are not picked up automatically in the cost estimate of a finished good. You are required to set up and assign overhead groups and overhead costing sheets so that indirect costs are applied during product costing.

The summary of the steps you require to generate the overhead cost include:

  • Define or use overhead costing sheet. Note that this cannot be configured freely like On-premise.
  • Assign overhead group to the material using the change material app.
  • Then the system picks the costing sheet. Finally, you can re-run costing and the overhead calculation should now be included in your cost estimate.

The application you need are Change Material, Manage Product Cost Estimates, Display Cost Estimates (Actual/Planned) and Manage Allocations.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris
